Name That Player
  • Home
  • About

Welcome!

Name That Player is a baseball player guessing game based on historical season statistics. A user is presented with hitting and/or pitching statistics of a former or current MLB player, and must deduce who it is based on the data. Players are allowed unlimited tries at guessing thhe correct player.

Game Modes

There are a couple different ways to play. First, you can specify the player pool you'd like to generate from. This can either be Random, which generates players from throughout the league, or Specific Team, which, as the name implies, generates players from a specified team. Next is the difficulty setting:

  • Normal: Generates players who have at least one All Star appearance in the past 25 years. Most of these players should be familiar to baseball fans.
  • Hard: Generates players who have at least one All Star appearance, going back to when the ASG was inaugurated in 1933. These players should be challenging but solvable for hardcore baseball fans.
  • Extreme: Generates any player who has ever appeared in a Major League Baseball game, whether it was 1 at-bat or a 20-year career, dating back to 1871. The database sits around 20,300 right now.

FAQ

Why are some of the Org acronyms outdated?

Some teams (ANA, FLA, TBD) have acronyms which are not necessarily up to date with the current acronyms of their respective organizations. The dataset used by this site relies on historical franchise data, which as far as I can tell, favors the original acronym of some franchises. I hope to have this rectified soon.

Why are there no statistics for 2023?

The dataset used only features complete season stats, so if a season is still underway, the statistics will not be available until it has concluded.

Where do you get your data from? Are you sure it's accurate?

Data is kindly provided for free by Baseball Databank under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License. While the overall integrity of the data is high, there still may be some errors.
